“Delaware State Police say Gov. John Carney’s state of emergency declaration ‘authorizes any Delaware law enforcement officer to stop a vehicle driving within the state simply because it is displaying out-of-state tags.’”

I disagree with Santorum. Under the emergency act the president has the power to promote the general welfare. The act was passed by Congress in 1976. His recent declaration was passed by Congress to among other things distribute the funding for virus relief.

Trump couldn’t do a lockdown in only one or a few states. It’s unconstitutional. He could’ve done a national lockdown (all 50 states) in tandem with his declaration of a national emergency. But he failed.
